node.title: Rockhole is a 'quiet, wonderful' and overcrowded community. Now the NT's COVID outbreak has hit
node.alt: A man stands in his living room in Rockhole.
node.description: On the edge of Katherine, by the river, around 350 people in the Binjari and Rockhole communities are at the new epicentre of the NT’s shifting COVID threat. But even before coronavirus, old and overcrowded housing was putting them at risk.
node.content:
["The first thing Kevin Rogers wants you to know about his home community of Rockhole is that it's a \"wonderful place\".", "\"Rockhole is about 13 kilometres from Katherine township along the Katherine River,\" he said.", "\"It's a quiet place, it's a wonderful place.", "\"We have families, kids running around \u2014 more kids than adults.\"", "The Aboriginal community of around 130 people is now in a hard lockdown after nine COVID-19 cases were discovered\u00a0in neighbouring Binjari, just on the other side of the river.", "No-one in either community is allowed to leave their homes or their yards.", "The outbreak now stands at 35, with three people in hospital.", "Authorities are preparing to find \"a lot\" more cases in Binjari and Rockhole and say the harsh restrictions are necessary because the threat to lives is \"extreme\".\u00a0", "At the time Mr Rogers spoke to ABC on the weekend, the case numbers were not known, but he was already very worried.", "Two of his family members had been taken to Howard Springs as close contacts of a positive COVID-19 case.", "
The house with the broken fence
", "", "
Kevin Rogers says he is concerned about his community's\u00a0vaccination rate.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "Mr Rogers loves his community, but the housing is not good.", "His neighbours refer to his place as \"the one with the broken fence\".", "His house is a three-bedroom house, but he said at least eight\u00a0people were living there.", "Most of them sleep on the floor in the living room.", "\"You know, all these houses were all built back in 1982, sometime like that.", "\"There are only three bedrooms and big mob of people live together. We don't know who to talk to now about getting a new house, a big house, houses with four or five rooms you know.\"", "Kevin Rogers is 63 and undergoes dialysis three times a week.", "He has been watching the news about the outbreak on the television at the clinic.", "\"Every time I go back on Monday, Wednesday and Friday, and it's always talking about new cases in the Northern Territory,\" he said.", "\"We have heard so many times overseas that many thousands of people, probably millions of people, lost their lives and now it's nearly close to communities right here, we need to educate, especially our young people, of what COVID-19 is.\"", "He is worried the message is not getting through.", "\"It's very hard for them families to understand,\" he said.", "\"They just live every day like nothing ever happened.", "\"I tell them, it's really a serious matter, we should take care of ourselves and our children.\"", "
Family is family, but they are not vaccinated
", "", "
Rockhole, a\u00a0community located roughly\u00a015 kilometres from the town of Katherine, is home to about 130 residents.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "Mr Rogers is double-vaccinated but he does not think many people in Rockhole are.", "The local Aboriginal health provider Wurli-Wurlinjang said the vaccination rate in Rockhole was \"lower than Binjari,\" which was at 38 per cent, but a number of doses delivered over the past few days\u00a0would have improved the rates in both communities.", "Mr Rogers knows some his family are not vaccinated.", "On Saturday he said he was considering kicking them out unless they went to get a vaccine by Monday or Tuesday this week.", "\"We have to help each other if they want to live in my house. They have to do the right thing.\"", "But Rockhole was locked down before that, on Saturday night.", "He said the police came in at first, followed by the nurses on Sunday morning.", "Mr Rogers said he was not just scared for his immediate family,\u00a0but for for friends and family in Binjari, and everyone else in the Territory too.", "\"I'm frightened not only for me, but for everyone, not just black fellas,\"", "
Governments disagree on housing responsibility, as COVID crisis looms
", "", "
Homes in the remote community of Rockhole are dated and overcrowded.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "Last week, as COVID spread for the first time in the Territory's Aboriginal communities, authorities were quick to recognise that it was predominantly spreading in crowded household and family groups in Katherine and Robinson River.", "The housing situation in the Territory is extremely complex, especially for those in remote communities and on Aboriginal homelands.", "Despite countless promises and a significant investment in recent years, the rollout of new homes and upgrades to existing ones has been characterised by significant delays and disagreements between levels of government over who is responsible.", "Binjari is part of the NT and Australian government-funded remote housing program, a $1.1 billion co-investment over five years.", "It has received three new public housing homes since 2016 and another three are planned: the government's accountability website notes 16 homes out of the 39 in Binjari are \"overcrowded\".", "Eleven Binjari homes have been approved for Room To Breathe\u00a0extensions (new rooms, new living spaces) but works have not started on any of them yet.", "Meanwhile, the Rockhole community is considered a homeland which means it only receives a modest amount of funding for repairs and maintenance from the Northern Territory government.", "In 2019-20 that was about $178,000 for municipal services (like waste, power and water) and $74,000 for housing maintenance.", "That is for the entire year and covers more than a dozen homes in Rockhole, plus administrative costs.", "The NT Department of Housing did not respond to a request before deadline to confirm if Mr Rogers was correct in saying there had been no new houses built in Rockhole since the 1980s.", "The NT government is currently in dispute with the Australian government about who is responsible for building new housing on homelands.", "The NT Remote Housing Minister, Chansey Paech, wants the Commonwealth to step in and fund them.", "The federal government has previously said it is a responsibility that belongs to the NT.", "NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner yesterday said ADF personnel would be helping manage parts of the situation, although the nature and extent of their role is not fully clear.", "NT Police are enforcing the lockdown rules in the communities, working with other agencies and non-government organisations.", "Mr Gunner yesterday said some form of lockdown \u2014\u00a0either hard lockdown or the less restrictive arrangements \u2014\u00a0would be in place for at least two weeks.", "", "
COVID cases surging across several European countries
"]
